subSubSection.paragraph:
TYPE
DEPOSITORY: of
L . youcefi : Laboratoire d'Acarologie, l'Ecole Pratique des Hautes Études, Paris
, France ; of
L . mcgregori : Canadian
National Collection of Insects, Arachnids and Nematodes, Ottawa, Ontario, Canada ; accession number 7273 ; of
L . paucisetosus
: not stated; of
L . ( L .) proteae
: Institute for Zoological Research, Potchefstroom University, Potchefstroom, South Africa ; of
L . lasiodactyli
: Biological Laboratory, Matsuyama Shinonome Junior College, Matsuyama, Japan ; accession number MSJC-BL 104 ; of
L . peritremus
: National Research Centre, Dokki, Cairo, Egypt (according to
Nasr & Abou-Awad, 1987 a
: 31 ).

TYPE
LOCALITY AND HABITAT : of L.
youcefi : Rovigo
, Algeria , in soil; of
L . mcgregori : Theeman Ranch, Modesto
, California, USA , on almond bark (Plantae: Rosaceae ); of
L . paucisetosus : Erlangen
, Germany , in rotten apples [Plantae: Rosaceae ], rotten thistle [Plantae: Asteraceae ], straw, meadow soil, grass and moss; of
L . ( L .) proteae : Humansdorp
, Cape, South Africa , on
Protea incompta
[Plantae: Proteaceae ]; of
L . lasiodactyli : Kuwabara, Matsuyama
, Ehime, Japan , on unstated substrate; of
L . peritremus
: Beni Suef, Upper Egypt , Egypt , in debris under citrus [Plantae: Rutaceae ] (according to
Zaher, 1986
: 71 ); Ehnasia, Beni-Sewef, Egypt , in debris under Citrus spp. (according to
Nasr & Abou-Awad, 1987 a
: 31 ).

NOTES : (a) Walter & Lindquist ( 1989 : 2800 ) suspected
L . youcefi
to be a senior synonym of
Lasioseius lasiodactyli
Ishikawa and
Lasioseius peritremus Nasr & Abou-Awad
; (b) Part of the specimens reported as
Lasioseius paucisetosus
by
Lapina ( 1976 a: 72 )
were suspected to correspond to
Lasioseius berlesei (Oudemans)
and
Lasioseius confusus Evans
by Walter & Lindquist ( 1989 : 2800 ).
